extracted_data_phrases: of authority and influence in family , social , and
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of authority and influence in family, social, and work circles lead me to make decisions that prioritized power over serving others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make the accumulation of wealth and material possessions the driving force in my life, prioritizing them over my relationship with God?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through your words , actions , or deeds
oppression.question: Did you mistreat, harass, or discriminate against others through your words, actions, or deeds, thereby exercising unjust power or authority over them?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Have I taken for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: as the source of my successes
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted God's provision in my accomplishments, forgetting to acknowledge Him as the source of my successes?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

towards others ' accomplishments , success , or possessions
envy.question: Have I ever had feelings of jealousy towards others' accomplishments, success, or possessions?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' accomplishments, desiring them for myself?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others, perhaps in a social setting or through digital communication, with words that were crude or inappropriate?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I demonstrate a lack of self-control in using language that was not respectful to others through my words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

such as dining out or entertaining friends
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it came to enjoying leisurely activities such as dining out or entertaining friends?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you engage in excessive eating or drinking, compromising your physical well-being?

among friends at social gatherings or online communities

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true among friends at social gatherings or online communities?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: for tasks that could have been avoided
impiety.question: Did I use Sunday, a day consecrated for rest and worship, for tasks that could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeking reconciliation , particularly in situations where family relationships are strained or when disagreements arise with close friends and loved ones
particularly in situations where family relationships are strained or when disagreements arise with close friends and loved ones
with close friends and loved ones
anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation, particularly in situations where family relationships are strained or when disagreements arise with close friends and loved ones?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
